com.cloudera.cdk.data.dao
Interface Dao<K,E>

Type Parameters:
K - The underlying key type.
E - The type of entity the DAO should return.
All Known Subinterfaces:
CompositeDao<K,E,S>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDao, CompositeBaseDao, GenericAvroDao, SpecificAvroDao
public interface Dao<K,E>

Interface for HBase Common DAOs. Supports basic get, put, delete, and scan operations over HBase. Almost all access and modifier functions take a row key. This key is represented by the Key type. The type parameter on the key type is the concrete java type that underlies the Key. A key can be constructed from this concrete type. All access and modifier methods on the DAO also support the ability to pass in this underlying type directly.

Method Detail

get

E get(K key)
Return the entity stored in HBase at the row specified with Key key. Return null if no such entity exists.

Parameters:
key - The key entity to get
Returns:
The entity of type T, or null if one is not found

put

boolean put(K key,
            E entity)
Put the entity into the HBase table with K key.

Parameters:
key -
entity - The entity to store
Returns:
True if the put succeeded, False if the put failed due to update conflict

increment

long increment(K key,
               String fieldName,
               long amount)
Increment a field named fieldName on the entity by value.

Parameters:
key - The key of the entity to increment
fieldName - The name of the field on the entity to increment. If the fieldName doesn't exist, an exception will be thrown.
amount - The amount to increment the field by
Returns:
The new field amount.

delete

void delete(K key)
Deletes the entity in the HBase table at K key.

Parameters:
key - The key of the entity to delete.

delete

boolean delete(K key,
               E entity)
Deletes the entity in the HBase table at K key. If that entity has a checkConflict field, then the delete will only be performed if the entity has the expected value in the table.

Parameters:
key - The key of the entity to delete.
entity - The entity, whose checkConflict field may be validated before the delete is performed.
Returns:
True if the put succeeded, False if the put failed due to update conflict

getScanner

EntityScanner<K,E> getScanner()
Get a scanner to scan the HBase table this DAO reads from. This method opens a scanner starting at the beginning of the table, and will scan to the end.

Returns:
An EntityScanner instance that can be used to iterate through entities in the table.

getScanner

EntityScanner<K,E> getScanner(PartialKey<K> startKey,
                              PartialKey<K> stopKey)
Get a scanner to scan the HBase table this DAO reads from. The scanner is opened starting at the first row greater than or equal to startKey. It will stop at the first row it sees greater than or equal to stopKey. If startKey is null, it will start at the first row in the table. If stopKey is null, it will stop at the last row in the table.

Parameters:
startKey -
stopKey -
Returns:
An EntityScanner instance that can be used to iterate through entities in the table.

EntityScanner<K,E> getScanner(K startKey,
                              K stopKey)
Get a scanner to scan the HBase table this DAO reads from. The scanner is opened starting at the first row greater than or equal to startKey. It will stop at the first row it sees greater than or equal to stopKey. If startKey is null, it will start at the first row in the table. If stopKey is null, it will stop at the last row in the table.

Parameters:
startKey -
stopKey -
Returns:
An EntityScanner instance that can be used to iterate through entities in the table.
